thread.title: Area roundup: Tech unbeaten streak reaches 14
thread.title_full: Area roundup: Tech unbeaten streak reaches 14

title: Area roundup: Tech unbeaten streak reaches 14
text:

Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Area roundup: Tech unbeaten streak reaches 14 TIMES STAFF REPORT 6:07 a.m. CDT October 13, 2015 Soccer (Photo: Times graphic) 
ALEXANDRIA — After a scoreless second half, Khalid Gelani scored twice to lift St. Cloud Tech to a Central Lakes Conference boys soccer win Monday at Alexandria. 
The win kept the Tigers unbeaten in their last 14 games, dating back to an Aug. 29 loss to Anoka. 
Tech, the Central Lakes champion, finishes the regular season with a 9-0-2 conference record and 13-1-2 overall. 
Bryan Helminick made two saves in goal for Tech, which attempted 25 shots with 23 ending up on goal. 
ST. CLOUD APOLLO 10, FERGUS FALLS 0 
Khalid Hussein scored a hat trick in St. Cloud Apollo’s rout of Fergus Falls in Central Lakes action. 
Abdiaziz Aden finished with two goals and two assists and Suleimon Ali also had two goals. 
Danny Wieber made one save in the shutout for the Eagles (9-3, 13-3). 
SARTELL 2, BRAINERD 1 
SARTELL — Parker Beumer and Ethan Kiffmeyer scored the goals for Sartell in a CLC win over Brainerd. 
The Sabres led 1-0 at halftime and Kiffmeyer’s second-half goal made it 2-0 before the Warriors tacked on a late goal. 
Colin Johnson stopped one shot in goal for Sartell (8-2-2 Central Lakes, 10-2-4 overall). 
SAUK RAPIDS 5, ROCORI 3 
SAUK RAPIDS — Grant Marolf finished with two goals and an assist to help Sauk Rapids defeat Rocori. 
With the score knotted at three at halftime, the Storm’s Patrick O’Neal and Granite Moliga scored goals that broke the tie. 
Trevon Mattson scored twice for the Spartans. 
GIRLS SOCCER 
ALEXANDRIA 4, 
ST. CLOUD TECH 1 
ALEXANDRIA — Bryn Hoffman scored St. Cloud Tech’s only goal midway through the first half in a Central Lakes Conference loss at Alexandria. 
The Cardinals led 3-0 at halftime and Hannah Hatling made 11 saves for the Tigers (2-10 Central Lakes, 2-13 overall). 
LITTLE FALLS 11, MELROSE 0 
MELROSE — Kia Friel scored three goals to lead Little Falls in shutout of Melrose in Granite Ridge Conference play. 
Jordan Schuett finished with a goal and two assists for the Flyers. Sarah Gold and MiKel Vacek had a goal and an assist each. 
Lauren Thielman and Marre Welinski combined for three saves in goal for Little Falls. 
SAUK RAPIDS 7, ROCORI 0 
COLD SPRING — Brooke Lorentz scored twice to lead Sauk Rapids in a dominating performance at Rocori. 
Chloe Stockinger and Tessa Fernholz scored their first varsity goals for the Storm (8-4, 10-6). 
Rocori goalkeeper Kaitlyn Reinhardt finished with 18 saves. 
VOLLEYBALL 
LITTLE FALLS 3, PIERZ 1 
PIERZ — Melanie Dorn finished with 19 kills, 17 set assists, 15 digs and four blocks to lead Little Falls past Pierz. 
Game scores were 17-25, 27-25, 25-16, 25-17. 
Laura Fregin had 13 kills and Sydney Berg added 11 for the Flyers. 
Jade Porter led the Pioneers with seven kills. 
SAUK CENTRE 3, BOLD 0 
OLIVIA — Becca Weir had 12 kills, four block and three ace serves for Sauk Centre in a win over BOLD. 
Game scores were 25-12, 25-20, 25-15. 
Morgan Gamradt had 12 digs, five kills and to ace serves and Jill Klaphake added 25 set assists and 10 digs for the Mainstreeters (22-3 overall). 
HOLDINGFORD 3, UPSALA 0 
UPSALA —Summer Storm finished with 10 kills and seven ace serves to lead Holdingford past Upsala. 
Game scores were 25-20, 25-13, 25-12. 
Callie Kostreba and Emily Ruprecht had seven kills apiece for the Huskers. Jenna Scott added 26 set assists and three ace serves. 
OSAKIS 3, ROYALTON 0 
ROYALTON — Lanae Sieben led Royalton with five kills in a Prairie Conference loss to Osakis. 
Game scores were 25-23, 25-12, 25-15. 
ST. CLOUD CHRISTIAN 3, MAPLEWOOD ACADEMY 2 
HUTCHINSON —Ellie Petrie led St. Cloud Christian with six kills and 15 digs. 
Game scores were 15-25, 25-18, 25-16, 23-25, 15-11. 
CROSS COUNTRY 
ROYALTON INVITATIONAL 
ROYALTON — Ben Borash and Jordan Malikowski finished second and third, respectively, to lead Royalton in the boys race. 
Borash finished in 17:46 and Malikowski finished in 17:55. 
The Royals took fifth in boys and fourth in girls. 
Kayley Kolbo led the Royalton girls with a 17th-place finish (24:46). 
GIRLS SWIMMING 
ST. CLOUD TECH 143, 
ST. CLOUD APOLLO 42 
Host St. Cloud Tech swam past St. Cloud Apollo to improve to 4-3 in the Central Lakes Conference and 4-4 overall. 
Tech’s 200-yard medley relay team of Emma Marek, Claire Heller, Alyssa Hoffman and Morgan Mangel finished in 2 minutes, 4.82 seconds. 
Jeeho Sohn won the 200 individual medley in 2:27.39. Savannah Henkel won the 100 freestyle in 58.6. The 200 freestyle team of Haley Condon, Henkel, Mangel and Sohn won in 1:47.39.
